newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU agrees compromise on VW subsidies.
newsitem.headline: EU agrees compromise on VW subsidies.

text.p: European Competition Commissioner Karel Van Miert said on Wednesday that the Commission had agreed on a compromise regarding illegal subsidies paid to Volkswagen AG.
Under the deal VW will not have to repay subsidies but Germany will freeze an equivalent amount of money due to go to the carmaker.
"So at the federal level there is a commitment to freeze an amount which is equivalent or parallel to that other amount," Van Miert told a news conference.
"The Commission therefore will not have to take any action regarding this," he said.

The Commission approved 540 million marks of a planned 780 million marks in proposed subsidies to VW to build two plants in the state of Saxony. But it said 100 million marks more than the approved amount have been illegally handed over to the auto maker.
VW had threatened in the past to take its investment elsewhere if the subsidies did not go through.
